column4: hello, when i play videos the images are really low-quality, kinda blurry. what should i do? thanks
what file format?
I use VLC, but with Totem it's even worse
i mean, what format is the video you're trying to play? perhaps your video output is set correctly, or you're using the wrong drivers
that happens with .avi and DVD discs too
what video card have you got?
i am ashamed to say i have no idea. where to i see it?
one moment
Intel 945
cat /etc/X11/xorg.conf | grep Driver
oh, you found your way. intel 945 isn't properly supported in ubuntu 7.10. its a bit too new
you're probably using vesa drivers, and they don't work at the cards full speed. that's why.
so no solutionbut wait for this to be fixed?
your best best will be ubuntu 8.04
sort of. i'm not even sure if there are drivers out there.
i feel your pain...
drivers for 945 should be released at some point right? Or is there a way I can beg the community to work on it?
the community is working on it: www.intellinuxgraphics.org or is it .com???
sooner than you might expect. haven't played with ubuntu hardy, so i don't know if its already in there somewhere
good! I'll patiently wait. I am new to linux, it took me forever to switch and now i can give the guys some time. thanks for your help, at least no i now!
I meant now i know ;)
thanks for your precious help
you're welcome. (i know) :)) i had issues with my ATI X1600 too when i got a new laptop.
